statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Andrew Keister scored 15 points and grabbed 18 rebounds to help Holy Cross defeat American U. 64-51 on Sunday.
article.headline: Keister's 15 points, 18 boards power Holy Cross to win
article.linkText: Keister's double-double leads Holy Cross to win
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. -- Andrew Keister scored 15 points and grabbed 18 rebounds to help Holy Cross defeat American U. 64-51 on Sunday. The Crusaders (8-19, 5-7 Patriot League) shot 50 percent (16 of 32) in the first half, building a 35-24 lead at halftime. American (8-19, 5-7) pulled within 48-41 on Stephen Lumpkins' two free throws with 8:50 to go, but wouldn't get any closer. Holy Cross answered with seven straight points to lead 56-41 on Eric Meister's layup with 2:11 left. The Crusaders scored 16 points off 14 turnovers and snapped a three-game losing streak to the Eagles. Holy Cross shot 46.5 percent from the field (25 of 55), while American connected on 39.6 percent of its shots (19 of 48), including 18.2 percent from 3-point range (4 of 22). Devin Brown added 16 points for the Crusaders and Dee Govens chipped in 10. Stephen Lumpkins scored 16 points for the Eagles.
